Description: Guild Newark St. Collection S-200 T-Bird Includes a Guild Padded Gigbag Have Questions? Send us a message and we will be glad to help you! An exact replica of the original version The S-200 TBird is one of Guild's most iconic, uniquely recognizable guitars. This reissue is an exact replica of the original versions produced between 1964 and 1968, featuring an asymmetrical all mahogany body sure to catch the eye of the guitarist looking to blaze his or her own trail. However, this guitar’s appeal isn’t just about its looks – its unique controls create the widest array of tones offered on any Guild instrument, drawing on its dual Guild LB-1 Little Bucker pickups to achieve almost every conceivable color on the palette. The LB-1s are replicas of Guild’s original humbuckers, offering an array of tones from sparkly clean single coil-esque spank to thick and warm humbucker sounds that fatten and sing when driven. Switching capabilities include rhythm or lead modes, pickup on/off, and standard volume and tone controls. When engaged, an optional tone capacitor creates single-coil tones while maintaining the hum-free reliability of the LB-1s. The TBird also features the Hagstrom Vintage Tremar, a reissue of the vibrato system that is considered the crown jewel of many Guild solid body electric models from the 1960s. Along with the authenticity of the Hagstrom Vintage Tremar as a historic Guild feature, this reissue includes mechanical refinements such as fully adjustable spring tension for a user-customizable feel and pitch range, and a locking trem arm for optimal security. The TBird features a vintage C shape set mahogany neck and bound rosewood fingerboard with pearloid block inlays. Other period-correct details include open gear vintage tuning machines, and famed asymmetrical headstock adorned with Guild’s logo and mother-of-pearl Thunderbird icon. The S-200 TBird Includes Guild’s deluxe padded gig bag. S-200 T-Bird Specifications Body shape: Double cutaway Body type: Solid body Body material: Solid wood Top wood: Not applicable Body wood: Mahogany Body finish: Gloss Polyurethane Orientation: Right handed Neck shape: C standard Neck wood: 1-piece Mahogany Joint: Set-in Scale length: 24.75 in. Truss rod: Standard Neck finish: Gloss Polyurethane Fretboard Material: Rosewood Radius: 12 in. Fret size: Medium jumbo Number of frets: 22 Inlays: Block Nut width: 1.69 in. (43 mm) Pickup Configuration: HH Neck: LB-1 Bridge: LB-1 Brand: Guild Active or passive pickups: Passive Series or parallel: Series Piezo: No Active EQ: No Special electronics: Dual mode pickup selection Control layout: Separate volume, tone Pickup switch: Slide switches for pickup activation Bridge type: Tremolo/Vibrato Bridge design: Tune-o-matic Tailpiece: Vintage Tremar Tuning machines: Grover open gear Color: Nickel Includes a Guild Gig bag Condition: When this model came into the refurbishing center they could not find anything wrong. By doing this we do not include any extras in the sale price for shipping 1. We carefully package and take the extra expense and time to package your item so it arrives safely 2. The instrument is detuned and the body, neck, and headstock are secured to prevent movement using packing paper or other materials 4. We then securely place the box into a heavy duty guitar box and carefully package for shipment using packing paper and other materials a. These boxes and packing materials cost extra and thus raise the cost to ship your guitar which is not reflected in the purchase price of each instrument but in the shipping cost; as destinations, insurance , etc. change the cost of each shipment 5. Once shipped please let us know if there are delayed delivery times and/or delays so we may help by contacting d. All instruments require a signature for delivery.
